title: London City in take-off deal
text:
London City in take-off deal London City in take-off deal LONDON City Airport’s US owner is heading for the departure lounge. PUBLISHED: 22:21, Thu, Aug 6, 2015 | UPDATED: 22:26, Thu, Aug 6, 2015 GETTY London City Airport up for sale 
Global Infrastructure Partners, which owns 75 per cent, will kickstart the sale process next month and is expected to make about three times the £750million it paid for the Docklands airport in 2006. 
GIP founding partner Michael McGhee said: “There is a huge demand for quality infrastructure investment opportunities with predictable cashflows. 
Airports of this quality are very scarce and it is very attractive for people like pension funds and sovereign wealth funds. We have had a good run.” 
GIP is not looking to sell interests in Gatwick and Edinburgh airports. Related articles
